message.content:
cs.IT, cs.GT, cs.CR, cs.MM, cs.NI 

This paper deals with the problem of covert communications, which involves hiding the transmission of information from a warden. This problem is closely related to information theory (cs.IT), as the coding rate to the receiver is an important factor in the payoff for the transmitter. The paper also formulates the problem as a game between the transmitter and warden, which suggests the use of game theory (cs.GT). Additionally, the paper considers the use of a jammer, which could fall under the category of multimedia (cs.MM) or networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). Finally, the paper deals with the issue of finite blocklength, which could be relevant to cryptography (cs.CR).
